H0.text: In 1984, in Bophal, India, there was a leak of 30 tons of methyl isocyanate, which resulted in the deaths of 25,000 people. What American chemical company owned the plant where the leak occurred. Union Carbide

H1.text: In 1984, in Bophal, India, there was a leak of 30 tons of methyl isocyanate, which resulted in the deaths of 25,000 people. What American chemical company owned the plant where the leak occurred. Dow Chemical

H2.text: In 1984, in Bophal, India, there was a leak of 30 tons of methyl isocyanate, which resulted in the deaths of 25,000 people. What American chemical company owned the plant where the leak occurred. DuPont

H3.text: In 1984, in Bophal, India, there was a leak of 30 tons of methyl isocyanate, which resulted in the deaths of 25,000 people. What American chemical company owned the plant where the leak occurred. Prest-O-Lite

A4.text: The owner of the factory, Union Carbide India Limited (UCIL), was a publicly-traded company which was majority-owned and controlled by the Union Carbide Corporation (UCC) of the United States, while the remaining 49.1 percent stake was held by the Indian public and Indian government-controlled banks.

A5.text: Dow Chemical Company purchased UCC in 2001, seventeen years after the disaster.

A6.text: Union Carbide India Limited, owned by Union Carbide (50.9%) and Indian investors (49.1%), operated a pesticide plant in Bhopal, the capital of Madhya Pradesh.
